program.name: Computer Programming and Analysis (Software Engineering Technology)
program.description: Plan courses for the Daytona State College Computer Programming and Analysis A.S. degree with prerequisite-aware guidance.

metaNotes: General education requirements total 15 credits spanning communication, math, science, humanities, and social sciences.
Students must complete either COP2800 or COP2360 to satisfy the object-oriented programming requirement.
Follow recommended sequencing to ensure prerequisites are satisfied before upper-level coursework.

exclusiveGroups.title: Object-Oriented Programming Choice
exclusiveGroups.description: Complete either COP2800 (Java) or COP2360 (C#). Completing one locks the other.

courses.title: Introduction to Composition
notes: Recommended first semester general education requirement.

courses.title: College Algebra
notes: Recommended math pathway for BSIT transfer articulation.

courses.title: Astronomy for Non-Science Majors
notes: Select one natural science elective to fulfill the requirement.

courses.title: Introduction to Humanities
notes: Choose one humanities core course; HUM2020 is a popular option.

courses.title: American Federal Government
notes: Satisfies the Civic Literacy competency graduation requirement.

courses.title: Introduction to Programming Logic
notes: Start here before any other programming course.

courses.title: Web Foundations and Standards
notes: Covers HTML, CSS, and accessibility fundamentals.

courses.title: Network Fundamentals
notes: Provides foundational networking knowledge for later security courses.

courses.title: Digital Systems and Microprocessors
notes: Plan for a lab-intensive course focusing on digital logic.

courses.title: Object-Oriented Programming in Java
notes: Choose either COP2800 or COP2360; completing one locks the other.
Focuses on Java syntax, OOP patterns, and GUI basics.

courses.title: C# Programming
notes: Prepares you for the .NET advanced programming sequence.

courses.title: Database Design and SQL
notes: Required before advanced software and analytics courses.

courses.title: Cybersecurity Fundamentals
notes: Explores security principles, risk management, and controls.

courses.title: Applied Artificial Intelligence
notes: Builds machine learning prototypes with Python and SQL.
courses.info: Requires comfort with object-oriented programming concepts.

courses.title: Software Engineering Processes
notes: Covers SDLC, agile practices, and project documentation.

courses.title: Advanced .NET Programming
notes: Implements enterprise solutions using C# and ASP.NET MVC.

courses.title: Cooperative Education Internship
notes: Coordinate with Career Services prior to enrolling.

courses.title: Linux System Administration
notes: Popular elective for cybersecurity or DevOps focus.

courses.title: Data Mining and Analytics
notes: Capstone-style elective emphasizing predictive analytics projects.

courses.title: Python for Analytics
notes: Ideal preparation for AI and data mining electives.
